readability_reflection:
String interpolation is easier to read and inherently understand it will return a string.
there are quotes around whole expression (so i know its a string)-->"my name is {name}, nice to meet you."
vs: "my name is" + {name} + "nice to meet you" <----(I missed adding a space after 'is' and before 'nice', its harder to type concatenations)
comprehension_debugging: string interpolations are easier to understand. its more concise.
preference_rationale: I would use string interpolation. it is just more readable, and easier to type out.
learning_curve: I have used both string interpolation and concatenation in python, javascript, java. My experience may have made it easier to read the syntax in this survey, but I still prefer interpolation.
